body:
To reproduce: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/22559#issuecomment-887305332

I connected to a peer. 18 seconds later, it connected to me. These connections persisted for over 12 hours. Both peers are running on a very recent `22.99.0` master branch.

This is an I2P only node, which I'm sure increases the chances of this happening because my peers.dat is tiny. I've observed it happening twice with different peers, but I'm unsure if I could reproduce it locally.

I do not have any `addnode=` in my config or anything like that.

`getpeerinfo` data from relevant peers:

title: net: redundant connections with a single peer
